abstract: Consumer advocates and some borrowers are raising concerns about new and booming industry of lenders like San Francisco-based Lending Club, which offer loans to borrowers more conveniently and at lower interest rates than traditional banks; credit-rating firm Moody's Investors Service has pointed to problematic practices at so-called marketplace lenders, and similarity between industry and mortgage lending leading up to 2008 crisis; consumer advocates have also taken issue with way some of companies collect payments.
lead_paragraph: Marketed as a way to get out of debt, loans from online lenders are instead leaving some people deeper underwater.

headline.main: Pitfalls for the Unwary Borrower Out on the Frontiers of Banking
headline.print_headline: Pitfalls for Unwary on the Frontier of Banking

snippet: Marketed as a way to get out of debt, loans from online lenders are instead leaving some people deeper underwater.
